PM.dose_adjustment: Avoid codeine. Use morphine or non-opioid alternatives.
PM.note: CYP2D6 poor metabolizers cannot convert codeine to its active metabolite morphine. CPIC recommends avoiding codeine in PMs.

IM.dose_adjustment: Reduced conversion to morphine expected. Monitor efficacy and consider alternative analgesic if inadequate response.
IM.note: CYP2D6 intermediate metabolizers have reduced capacity to activate codeine. CPIC suggests using an alternative or monitoring closely.

NM.note: Normal CYP2D6 metabolism. No dosing adjustment required per CPIC guidelines.

RM.dose_adjustment: Increased morphine formation possible. Monitor for signs of opioid toxicity.
RM.note: CYP2D6 rapid metabolizers may produce higher morphine levels. CPIC recommends caution.

URM.dose_adjustment: Avoid codeine due to risk of life-threatening morphine toxicity.
URM.note: CYP2D6 ultrarapid metabolizers convert codeine to morphine at dangerously high rates. CPIC strongly recommends avoiding codeine.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with clinical monitoring.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine CYP2D6 phenotype. Exercise caution.

PM.dose_adjustment: Reduce initial warfarin dose significantly. Monitor INR closely and titrate slowly.
PM.note: CYP2C9 poor metabolizers have markedly reduced warfarin clearance, increasing bleeding risk. CPIC recommends a substantially lower starting dose.

IM.dose_adjustment: Consider lower initial dose. Monitor INR carefully.
IM.note: CYP2C9 intermediate metabolizers have reduced warfarin metabolism. CPIC recommends a moderately reduced dose.

NM.dose_adjustment: Standard dosing with routine INR monitoring.
NM.note: Normal CYP2C9 metabolism. Standard warfarin dosing per CPIC guidelines.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with careful INR monitoring.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine CYP2C9 phenotype. Monitor closely.

PM.dose_adjustment: Avoid clopidogrel. Use prasugrel or ticagrelor as alternative antiplatelet therapy.
PM.note: CYP2C19 poor metabolizers cannot adequately activate clopidogrel. CPIC recommends alternative antiplatelet agents.

IM.dose_adjustment: Reduced activation of clopidogrel expected. Consider alternative antiplatelet therapy.
IM.note: CYP2C19 intermediate metabolizers have reduced clopidogrel activation. CPIC suggests considering alternatives.

NM.note: Normal CYP2C19 metabolism. Standard clopidogrel dosing per CPIC guidelines.

RM.note: CYP2C19 rapid metabolizers have adequate clopidogrel activation.

URM.note: CYP2C19 ultrarapid metabolizers have adequate clopidogrel activation.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with clinical monitoring.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine CYP2C19 phenotype. Monitor antiplatelet response.

PM.dose_adjustment: Avoid simvastatin or prescribe a lower dose (max 20 mg). Consider alternative statin (e.g., rosuvastatin, pravastatin).
PM.note: SLCO1B1 poor function increases systemic simvastatin exposure, raising myopathy risk. CPIC recommends avoidance or dose limitation.

IM.dose_adjustment: Use lower dose of simvastatin and monitor for muscle symptoms.
IM.note: SLCO1B1 intermediate function moderately increases simvastatin exposure. CPIC recommends dose reduction.

NM.note: Normal SLCO1B1 function. Standard simvastatin dosing per CPIC guidelines.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with monitoring for muscle symptoms.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine SLCO1B1 phenotype. Monitor for myopathy.

PM.dose_adjustment: Avoid azathioprine or reduce dose to 10% of standard. Monitor blood counts weekly.
PM.note: TPMT poor metabolizers accumulate cytotoxic thioguanine nucleotides, causing severe myelosuppression. CPIC recommends drastic dose reduction or avoidance.

IM.dose_adjustment: Start with 30-70% of standard dose. Monitor blood counts closely.
IM.note: TPMT intermediate metabolizers have reduced thiopurine metabolism. CPIC recommends starting at a reduced dose.

NM.note: Normal TPMT activity. Standard azathioprine dosing per CPIC guidelines.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with blood count monitoring.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine TPMT phenotype. Monitor for myelosuppression.

PM.dose_adjustment: Avoid fluorouracil entirely due to high risk of fatal toxicity.
PM.note: DPYD poor metabolizers cannot adequately clear fluoropyrimidines, leading to life-threatening toxicity. CPIC strongly recommends avoidance.

IM.dose_adjustment: Reduce starting dose by at least 50%. Monitor closely for toxicity.
IM.note: DPYD intermediate metabolizers have reduced fluoropyrimidine clearance. CPIC recommends significant dose reduction.

NM.note: Normal DPYD activity. Standard fluorouracil dosing per CPIC guidelines.

Unknown.dose_adjustment: Insufficient genetic data. Use standard dosing with close toxicity monitoring.
Unknown.note: Unable to determine DPYD phenotype. Monitor for fluoropyrimidine toxicity.
